name: access_token
description: Get information about the current API access token including its scopes and UUID

name: create_build
description: Trigger a new build on a Buildkite pipeline for a specific commit and branch, with optional environment variables, metadata, and author information

arguments.name: branch
arguments.desc: The branch to build

arguments.name: commit
arguments.desc: The commit SHA to build

arguments.name: message
arguments.desc: The commit message for the build

arguments.name: org_slug
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the pipeline

arguments.name: pipeline_slug
arguments.desc: The slug of the pipeline

arguments.name: environment
arguments.desc: Environment variables to set for the build

arguments.name: metadata
arguments.desc: Meta-data values to set for the build

name: create_pipeline
description: Set up a new CI/CD pipeline in Buildkite with YAML configuration, repository connection, and cluster assignment

arguments.name: cluster_id
arguments.desc: The ID value of the cluster the pipeline will be associated with

arguments.name: configuration
arguments.desc: The pipeline configuration in YAML format. Contains the build steps and pipeline settings. If not provided, a basic configuration will be used

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the pipeline

arguments.name: org_slug
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the pipeline. This is used to determine where to create the pipeline

arguments.name: repository_url
arguments.desc: The Git repository URL to use for the pipeline

arguments.name: cancel_running_branch_builds
arguments.desc: Cancel running builds when new builds are created on the same branch

arguments.name: default_branch
arguments.desc: The default branch for builds and metrics filtering

arguments.name: description
arguments.desc: The description of the pipeline

arguments.name: skip_queued_branch_builds
arguments.desc: Skip intermediate builds when new builds are created on the same branch

arguments.name: tags
arguments.desc: Tags to apply to the pipeline. These can be used for filtering and organization

name: current_user
description: Get details about the user account that owns the API token, including name, email, avatar, and account creation date

name: get_artifact
description: Get detailed information about a specific artifact including its metadata, file size, SHA-1 hash, and download URL

arguments.name: url
arguments.desc: The URL of the artifact to get

name: get_build
description: Get detailed information about a specific build including its jobs, timing, and execution details

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: The number of the build

arguments.name: org
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the pipeline

arguments.name: pipeline_slug
arguments.desc: The slug of the pipeline

arguments.desc: The number of the build

arguments.name: org
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the pipeline

arguments.name: pipeline_slug
arguments.desc: The slug of the pipeline

arguments.name: org

description: Get detailed information about a specific queue including its key, description, dispatch status, and hosted agent configuration

arguments.desc: The id of the cluster

arguments.name: org
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the pipeline

arguments.name: queue_id
arguments.desc: The id of the queue

name: get_failed_executions
description: Get failed test executions for a specific test run in Buildkite Test Engine. Optionally get the expanded failure details such as full error messages and stack traces.

arguments.name: org
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the test suite

arguments.name: run_id
arguments.desc: The ID of the test run

arguments.name: test_suite_slug
arguments.desc: The slug of the test suite the run belongs to

arguments.name: include_failure_expanded
arguments.desc: Include the expanded failure details such as full error messages and stack traces. This can be used to explain and diganose the cause of test failures.

arguments.name: page
arguments.desc: Page number for pagination (min 1)

arguments.name: perPage
arguments.desc: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

name: get_job_logs
description: Get the log output and metadata for a specific job, including content, size, and header timestamps. Automatically saves to file for large logs to avoid token limits.

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: The build number

arguments.name: job_uuid
arguments.desc: The UUID of the job

arguments.name: org
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the pipeline

arguments.name: pipeline_slug
arguments.desc: The slug of the pipeline

name: get_jobs
description: Get all jobs for a specific build including their state, timing, commands, and execution details

arguments.name: build_number
arguments.desc: The number of the build

arguments.name: org
arguments.desc: The organization slug for the owner of the pipeline

arguments.name: pipeline_slug
arguments.desc: The slug of the pipeline

arguments.name: include_agent
arguments.desc: Include detailed agent information in the response. When false (default), only agent ID is included to reduce response size.

arguments.name: job_state
arguments.desc: Filter jobs by state. Supports actual states (scheduled, running, passed, failed, canceled, skipped, etc.)

arguments.name: page
arguments.desc: Page number for pagination (min 1)

arguments.name: perPage
arguments.desc: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 50)
